result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrin Rodriguez Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BRANCH 4 FOR BRANCH 21
Defendant Darrin Rodriguez Spencer in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Darrin Rodriguez Spencer in custody.  Kathryn E. Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

Sentencing Proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.

As to COUNT 1:
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 48 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.

As to COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Other treatment and/or counseling as determined necessary by probation agent.  
-Maintain absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, restitution, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Payments to be applied to restitution first.  
-Provide DNA Sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Pay restitution to victim (Cheesecake Factory) through probation agent.  Restitution set at $200.00.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department until next scheduled court appearance.

All conditions of bail previously set to remain.  Defendant taken into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office.
